name: Content Mate v1.6 (Shared) (AI Avatar | X Videos)

parameters.command:
=# knobs
TOP_H=608
GAP=1
PUSH=0
CROP_TOP={{ $json.fields.TopCrop[0] }}
EXTRA_CROP=0

# compute the bottom height
BOTTOM_H=$((1920 - (TOP_H + GAP + PUSH) - EXTRA_CROP))
BOT_Y=$((TOP_H + GAP + PUSH))

ffmpeg -y \
-i "/videos/{{ $('Update Voice3').item.json.id }}_xvideo.mp4" \
-i "/videos/{{ $json.id }}_clone.mp4" \
-filter_complex "
color=c=black:size=1080x1920:d=360[bg];
[0:v]scale=1080:${TOP_H}:flags=bicubic[top];
[1:v]scale=1080:-2[vs];
[vs]crop=w=1080:h=${BOTTOM_H}:x=0:y=${CROP_TOP}[bot];
[bg][top]overlay=x=0:y=0[tmp];
[tmp][bot]overlay=x=0:y=${BOT_Y}[v];
[1:a]volume=1.5[a]
" \
-map "[v]" -map "[a]" \
-t "$(ffprobe -v error -show_entries format=duration -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 "/videos/{{ $json.id }}_clone.mp4")" \
-c:v libx264 -pix_fmt yuv420p -crf 18 -preset veryfast \
-c:a aac -movflags +faststart \
/videos/{{ $('Update Voice3').item.json.id }}_output_vertical.mp4

base.cachedResultName: Content Mate (AI Avatar | X Videos) v1.5

values.content:
=You are a caption generator that returns ONLY a single valid JSON object with these keys:
"Instagram caption", "Facebook caption", "Twitter caption", "TikTok caption", "YouTube short caption", "YouTube short title", "LinkedIn caption", "Bluesky caption", "Threads caption", "Pinterest caption".

Goal
Create concise, platform-tailored captions for a short-form video. The user will provide a YouTube or short-form script as input. Extract the hook, the core benefit, 1 to 2 concrete specifics, and a clear CTA. Keep everything punchy because the video carries most context.

Inputs you will receive
- video_script: the full script or outline
- topic or product: optional
- target_audience: optional
- desired_CTA: optional
- hashtags_or_keywords: optional
- tone: optional (default energetic, helpful)

Global rules
- Output JSON only. No extra text, no markdown, no comments.
- Do not include newline characters inside any value unless the platform rules below explicitly allow line breaks.
- Never fabricate facts. Derive claims from the video_script.
- Keep captions distinct across platforms. No copy-paste.
- Prefer 1 emoji max where appropriate. If tone is professional, use zero.
- Use 1 to 3 short hashtags max when appropriate. Avoid spammy blocks of tags.
- Avoid platform-specific handles unless provided.
- Language: match the language of the video_script.

Platform styles and constraints
1) Instagram caption
- Aim 80 to 120 characters.
- One short hook, one benefit, soft CTA.
- Up to 2 hashtags at the end.
- Optional single emoji near the start.
- No links.

2) Facebook caption
- Aim 100 to 160 characters.
- Friendly and clear. One sentence plus CTA.
- Add 1 to 2 hashtags only if natural.
- Links allowed only if provided in inputs.

3) Twitter caption
- Aim 80 to 120 characters for scannability.
- Tight hook + 1 key detail + short CTA.
- Max 2 hashtags. Avoid emojis unless the tone is informal.

4) TikTok caption
- Aim 60 to 100 characters.
- High energy hook plus CTA like "watch to the end".
- Up to 3 short, relevant hashtags.
- No links.

5) YouTube short caption
- Aim 100 to 150 characters.
- Clarify the value viewers get in one line. One CTA to subscribe or try the tip.
- 1 to 2 hashtags max.

6) YouTube short title
- Aim 40 to 60 characters.
- Lead with outcome or transformation. Include a power verb.
- No brackets clickbait. No punctuation at the end unless it is a question.

7) LinkedIn caption
- Aim 140 to 200 characters.
- Professional, benefit-led, one specific insight from the script, and a light CTA to comment or learn more.
- No emojis unless the industry is casual. No hashtags unless 1 highly relevant tag adds value.

8) Bluesky caption
- Aim 80 to 120 characters.
- Conversational and slightly tech-savvy tone.
- 1 to 2 hashtags max. No emojis unless tone is casual.
- Encourage replies with a question or curiosity.

9) Threads caption
- Aim 80 to 120 characters.
- More casual, community-driven vibe. Feel like talking to friends.
- 1 emoji max, if it feels natural.
- 1 to 2 hashtags max.

10) Pinterest caption
- Aim 100 to 150 characters.
- Inspire curiosity or promise a benefit.
- Can include 1 to 2 hashtags for search relevance.
- No emojis unless they fit a creative or lifestyle tone.

Content extraction from video_script
- Hook: the most surprising or outcome-focused line.
- Benefit: the clearest value to the viewer.
- Specific: one stat, step, or tool mentioned.
- CTA: a single action phrase aligned with desired_CTA if provided.

Formatting rules
- Escape any internal quotes as needed to keep valid JSON.
- Do not exceed each platform‚Äôs character targets.
- If an input is missing, make the best safe assumption. Do not leave fields empty.

Return format (example keys only; values must be generated from the provided script):
{
  "Instagram caption": "...",
  "Facebook caption": "...",
  "Twitter caption": "...",
  "TikTok caption": "...",
  "YouTube short caption": "...",
  "YouTube short title": "...",
  "LinkedIn caption": "...",
  "Bluesky caption": "...",
  "Threads caption": "...",
  "Pinterest caption": "..."
}

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "customMapFunction": "(object) => { return {...object} }",
  "end": "{{ $now.toISODate() }}",
  "includeSearchTerms": true,
  "maxItems": 10,
  "onlyImage": false,
  "onlyQuote": false,
  "onlyTwitterBlue": false,
  "onlyVerifiedUsers": false,
  "onlyVideo": false,
  "searchTerms": [
    "from:{{ $json.Handle }} filter:videos lang:en since:{{ $now.minus({ days: 4 }).toISODate() }} until:{{ $now.toISODate() }}",
    "from:{{ $json.Handle }} filter:nativeretweets filter:videos lang:en since:{{ $now.minus({ days: 4 }).toISODate() }} until:{{ $now.toISODate() }}"
  ],
  "sort": "Latest",
  "start": "{{ $now.minus({ days: 4 }).toISODate() }}",
  "tweetLanguage": "en"
}

base.cachedResultName: Content Mate (AI Clone) (X Video) v1.2 (vid only)

parameters.command:
=#!/bin/sh
set -eu -o pipefail

RID="{{ $('Update Voice3').item.json.id }}"
IN_RAW="${RID}_xvideo_9x16.mp4"
FIRST_3="${RID}_output_vertical.mp4"
MUSIC_RAW="${RID}_music.mp3"

OUT="/videos/${RID}_video_only.mp4"

# Resolve absolute paths
case "$IN_RAW"    in /*) IN="$IN_RAW"     ;; *) IN="/videos/$IN_RAW"     ;; esac
case "$FIRST_3"   in /*) F3="$FIRST_3"    ;; *) F3="/videos/$FIRST_3"    ;; esac
case "$MUSIC_RAW" in /*) MUSIC="$MUSIC_RAW";; *) MUSIC="/videos/$MUSIC_RAW";; esac

# Sanity checks
[ -f "$IN" ]    || { echo "ERROR: Input video not found: $IN" >&2; exit 1; }
[ -f "$F3" ]    || { echo "ERROR: Overlay not found: $F3" >&2; exit 1; }
[ -f "$MUSIC" ] || { echo "ERROR: Music not found: $MUSIC" >&2; exit 1; }

rm -f -- "$OUT" || true

# Explanation:
# - Overlay fades out at 2.5s (0.5s crossfade).
# - Voice track from IN is boosted 1.5x louder.
# - Music stays at 0.1 volume.
# - Overlay scales up and centers.

ffmpeg -hide_banner -loglevel error -y -nostdin -threads 2 \
  -i "$IN" \
  -i "$F3" \
  -i "$MUSIC" \
  -filter_complex "
    [1:v]trim=0:3,setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=iw*1:-1,fade=t=out:st=2.5:d=0.5:alpha=1[overlayfit]; \
    [0:v]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS[base]; \
    [base][overlayfit]overlay=(W-w)/2:(H-h)/2:enable='between(t,0,3)'[vout]; \
    [0:a]volume=1.5[a0]; \
    [2:a]volume=0.1[a2]; \
    [a0][a2]amix=inputs=2:duration=first:dropout_transition=3[aout]
  " \
  -map "[vout]" -map "[aout]" \
  -c:v libx264 -preset veryfast -crf 18 -pix_fmt yuv420p \
  -c:a aac -b:a 192k \
  -movflags +faststart \
  "$OUT"

printf '{"output":"%s"}' "$OUT"

=#!/bin/sh
set -eu

RID="{{ $('Update Voice3').item.json.id }}"

INPUT="/videos/${RID}_xvideo.mp4"
VOICE="/videos/${RID}_voice_full.mp3"
OUTPUT="/videos/${RID}_xvideo_9x16.mp4"

ffmpeg -y \
  -i "$INPUT" \
  -i "$VOICE" \
  -filter_complex "\
    color=c=black:s=1080x1920:d=999[bg]; \
    [0:v]scale=1080:-1[vid]; \
    [bg][vid]overlay=(W-w)/2:(H-h)/2:eval=init,format=yuv420p[v]" \
  -map "[v]" -map 1:a \
  -c:v libx264 -c:a aac -pix_fmt yuv420p \
  -shortest -movflags +faststart "$OUTPUT"

printf '{\"output\":\"%s\"}' \"$OUTPUT\"

=#!/bin/sh
set -eu

IN="/videos/{{ $('Update Voice3').item.json.id }}_video_only.mp4"
SUBS="/videos/{{ $('Update Voice3').item.json.id }}_subtitles.ass"
OUT="/videos/{{ $('Update Voice3').item.json.id }}_output.mp4"

ffmpeg -y -i "$IN" -vf "subtitles='$SUBS'" -c:v libx264 -c:a copy "$OUT"

printf '{"output":"%s"}' "$OUT"

values.content:
=You are a viral YouTube Shorts scriptwriter.
	‚Ä¢	Read the target length (seconds) and compute WORD_BUDGET = floor(seconds * WPS). Default WPS = {{ $json.wps || 2.4 }} .
	‚Ä¢	Output one script only, no pre/post text.
	‚Ä¢	Never exceed WORD_BUDGET words. If your draft is longer, compress before replying.
	‚Ä¢	6th-grade reading level.
	‚Ä¢	First sentence = announcement of exactly what happened.
	‚Ä¢	2nd sentence starts the details; include specific facts from the inspiration.
	‚Ä¢	the text should be written in the style interesting conversational tone
	‚Ä¢	End with: a one sentence close of a shocking statement!



Do not write more words than 2.4 words per second
Do not write less words than 2.4 words per second

=find out more information about: 
{{ $('HTTP Apify').item.json.text }}

Posted by {{ $('HTTP Apify').item.json.author_name }} on x. 

They may have annoucned something or an update?
I want you to find as many facts and information about it.

Come back with at least 500 words

value.Name: ={{ $('Apify POST').item.json.author.userName }}
value.Ratio:
={{
(() => {
  const r =
    $json.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.retweet?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweet?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweet?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.retweeted_status?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweeted_status?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweeted_status?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.quote?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.quoted_status?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quoted_status?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quoted_status?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.quoted_tweet?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quoted_tweet?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $('Apify POST').item.json.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $('Apify POST').item.json.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $('Apify POST').item.json.retweet?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $('Apify POST').item.json.retweet?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio;

  // Clean array output
  return Array.isArray(r) ? `[${r.join(',')}]` : r;
})()
}}

    "frames_per_second": 16,
    "interpolate_output": true,
    "lora_scale_transformer": 1,
    "lora_scale_transformer_2": 1
  }
